The claim was made by Wisconsin Gov: Scott Walker, who is running for a third term in the 2018 election.
The claim was made on Twitter on May 31: 2018, without any qualifications or specific details.
The governor: s office provided tallies from the State Budget Office, which showed that the tax cuts would exceed $8.85 billion through June 2019.
